text: The UEFA European Football Championship, commonly known as the UEFA European Championship and as the Euros, is the main association football competition played by the senior men's national teams of the members of the Union of European Football Associations (UEFA). It has been held every four years since 1960, in the even-numbered year between FIFA World Cup tournaments. It was first called the European Nations' Cup. It changed to the current name in 1968. Italy are the current European champions after winning the 2020 tournament. == Results == Years Hosts Final Winners Score Runners up Stadium 1960 Details 2–1 Parc des Princes, Paris 1964 Details 2 – 1 Santiago Bernabéu, Madrid 1968 Details 1 – 1 a.e.t (2 × 0) replay StadiumOlimpic, Rome 1972 Details 3 – 0 Heysel Stadium, Brussels 1976 Details 2 – 2 a.e.t (5 × 3) Red Star Stadium, Belgrade 1980 Details 2 – 1 Stadio San Paolo, Napoles 1984 Details 2 – 0 Parc des Princes, Paris 1988 Details 2 – 0 Stadium OlympiastadionMunich 1992 Details 2 – 0 Ullevi, Gothenburg 1996 Details 2 – 1 a.e.t Wembley Stadium, London 2000 Details & 2 – 1 a.e.t De Kuip, Rotterdam 2004 Details 1 – 0 Estádio da Luz, Lisbon 2008 Details & 1 – 0 Ernst-Happel-Stadion, Vienna 2012 Details & 4 – 0 Stadio Olímpico, Kyiv 2016 Details 1 – 0 a.e.t Stade de France, Saint-Denis 2020 Details 1 – 1 a.e.t (3 × 2) Wembley Stadium, London 2024 Details 2 – 1 Olympiastadion, Berlin 2028 Details ??? == Wins by team == Teams Winners Runners-up Semi-finalists 3rd Place 4th Place Top 2 Top 4 3 (1972, 1980, 1996) 3 (1976, 1992, 2008) 3 (1988, 2012, 2016) — — 6 9 4 (1964, 2008, 2012, 2024) 1 (1984) 1 (2020) — — 4 5 2 (1984, 2000) 1 (2016) 1 (1996) — 1 (1960) 3 5 2 (1968, 2020) 2 (2000, 2012) 1 (1988) — 1 (1980) 4 6 1 (1960) 3 (1964, 1972, 1988) 1 (2008) — 1 (1968) 4 6 1 (1976) 1 (1996) 1 (2004) 2 (1960, 1980) — 2 5 1 (2016) 1 (2004) 3 (1984, 2000, 2012) — — 2 5 1 (1988) — 3 (1992, 2000, 2004) 1 (1976) — 1 5 1 (1992) — 2 (1984, 2020) — 1 (1964) 1 4 1 (2004) — — — — 1 1 — 2 (1960, 1968) — — 1 (1976) 2 3 — 1 (2020) 1 (1996) (1) 1968 — 1 3 — 1 (1980) — (1) 1972 — 1 2 — — — (1) 1964 1 (1972) 0 2 — — 1 (1992) — — 0 1 — — 1 (2008) — — 0 1 — — 1 (2016) — — 0 1 ==Related pages== *List of UEFA European Championship finals ==Other websites== *Official website at Union of European Football Associations *
